articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Aircraft dropped water and fire retardant on steep hills to stem the eastward spread of the Palisades Fire. The LA county supervisor called it "another night of unimaginable terror and heartbreak."
articles.title: San Fernando Valley under threat as Los Angeles fire rages on

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: A top level Israeli security delegation arrived in Qatar on Sunday for talks on a Gaza hostage and ceasefire deal, a spokesperson for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, in a possible sign of so-far elusive agreements nearing.
articles.title: Top Israeli security delegation in Doha for Gaza talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "There will undoubtedly be more," he said.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says he's ready to exchange N. Korean soldiers for Ukrainians held in Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan, the Philippines and the United States vowed to further strengthen their ties under a trilateral arrangement in the face of growing tensions in regional waters, Manila said on Monday following a call among their leaders.
articles.title: Japan, Philippines, U.S. vow to deepen cooperation, Manila says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwanese charged with suspicion of spying on behalf of China rose by a third to 64 people last year, the island's National Security Bureau said, adding most were current or retired soldiers.
articles.title: Taiwan reports 'significant rise' in suspected Chinese espionage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The foreign ministers of South Korea and Japan will hold talks in the South Korean capital on Monday, as the key U.S. allies seek to underscore improved ties and shared security concerns amid the worst political crisis in decades in Seoul.
articles.title: South Korea, Japan foreign ministers to meet amid political turmoil in Seoul

articles.author: Nidhi Verma, Chen Aizhu, Siyi Liu, Florence Tan
articles.description: Chinese and Indian refiners will source more oil from the Middle East, Africa and the Americas, boosting prices and freight costs.
articles.title: Tougher U.S. sanctions to curb Russian oil supply to China and India

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Hindus seeking absolution of their sins immersed themselves on Monday in freezing waters at the confluence of sacred rivers, as India began a six-week festival expected to draw the world's largest gathering of humanity.
articles.title: Tens of thousands take holy dip in India as Maha Kumbh festival begins

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand's cabinet has approved a draft law that would legalise gambling and casinos, a move that seeks to boost tourism and investment, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said on Monday.
articles.title: Thai cabinet approves draft law to legalise casinos and gambling, PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: That includes about 300 deaths and 2,700 injuries.
articles.title: North Korean troop fatalities and injuries exceed 3,000 in Ukraine, Seoul says
